If you're wondering why this is so annoying it's that if someone misspells a word it fucking ruins your day.
topics.author: 38b55cdf63616403d7560600

topics.body:
So I've been watching Two Saiyins Play, which if you don't know is a series of Lets Play videos done by Team Four Star in which Vegeta and Nappa play various video games together, and it got me thinking about character.

There is a pretty common problem with characters across all sorts of media in that you frequently have characters who seem to have no real life outside of the story they exist in. I believe that if you can't imagine a character just going to see a movie or whatever in their down time then you have failed to create a decent character and rather have only made a humanoid plot device, someone who exists only to move the story along.

Even obsessives need something else to do, and if they don't have something else to do then that should be a major point about their character, think Leon in the film of the same name, a guy who's life is entirely doing violent things to the mob to the point that at the start of the movie he is shown just coming home from work to sleep in a chair with a gun in his hand.

In contrast to that excellent example, consider Kratos from the God of War series. Can you picture him, in the context of his own universe, actually enjoying something? Because I can't.

The difference between Leon and Kratos is that in the case of Leon we are made to care that his life is so empty. It shows how broken he is as a human being. In Kratos' case he exists simply as a delivery service for angsty violence.

The reason Two Saiyins Play led me down this path is because there is something oddly humanizing about seeing Vegeta have a hobby, especially one as innocuous as gaming. There is actually a story arc to the videos, he starts out dismissive and even contemptuous of gaming and then grows to genuinely enjoy it.

Anyways, just a thought.
topics.author: 4f41ee04945b701c41002af7

topics.body:
"@uc9":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/538f0cf16368721f379a0300#post_538f0cf16368721f379a0300
You know Looney Tunes?
Well, imagine it having an actual storyline and that it was more like Super Robot Monkey Team Hyper Force Go! (SRMTHFG!).

Here's a short summary:
In the year 2772, a giant meteor crashed on the fictional city of Acmetropolis, knocking it off its axis. Instead of destroying the planet, the meteor gave out a cosmic energy that mutated the descendants of the Looney Toons and gave them superpowers. Under the guide of a mysterious alien, they use their powers to protect Acmetropolis from aliens, monsters and other cosmic being.

_(Note, none of these characters are actually Looney Tunes characters. According to the writers, they are the *descendants* of the original Looney Tunes including Taz, Daffy Duck, Bugs Bunny, Lola Bunny, Wile E. Coyote and the Road Runner.)_
topics.author: 4fe1b9f47f123b13df002976
